Description:
VISIONARY ARCHITECT DESIGN!
New life has been breathed into this modern home after a comprehensive renovation by the current owners. These people know how to renovate a home with flair while keeping it true to it's 70's origins.
Behind the simple facade lies a split-level family home boasting four bedrooms, two designer bathrooms, two living areas and a fabulous outdoor living deck.
Gleaming polished Tasmanian oak floors run throughout while clerestory windows bathe all rooms in abundant natural light.
First off the entry hall is the main bedroom. It's a parent's private sanctuary with big window to the garden, walk-in robe and new ensuite finished with full-wall tiling and quality fittings.
Next is a generous study before the hallway opens up to the formal lounge room with a wall of floor-to-ceiling windows providing a panoramic leafy vista at one end and formal dining/reading room opposite.
The all-white kitchen is a showcase of bespoke cabinetry equipped with Miele oven, range hood, and dishwasher, Sharp convection microwave and Asko induction cook top. A servery window over the sink slides open to an outdoor cafe bench, ideal for casual breakfasts or coffee.
Internal comfort is ensured with gas central heating, three split system units and a clean and neutral color scheme throughout.
Enjoy relaxed living inside and out with a spacious family living/dining room adjoining the kitchen opening to an all-weather, elevated timber deck. Best shared with others, it has a natural gas barbecue alongside and is perfect for laid-back meals, family celebrations or just relaxing on balmy evenings.
Stunning re-worked bathroom boasts a cast-iron claw-foot bath for relaxing and reclining under a picture window, glossy white tiles and new fittings. The laundry has been made over in similar fashion and includes copious new storage options.
A 3m x 3m storage shed/studio complete with power, shelving and benches overlooks a very private, sunny courtyard off the laundry.
Well-established yet easy-care gardens include blue-stone paved paths, roses, shady gum and paperbark trees.
A double carport at the front and extra off-street parking space takes care of the family fleet while the 915 (approx.)m² block is secured by Colorbond fencing all round with vehicular access to the rear yard for trailer, caravan etc.
Tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac in the coveted McIvor Hill locale and handy to schools, supermarket, transport and sporting facilities, this property is the perfect package of position and panache.
